summary:
## Summary

A **Cartesian coordinate system** uses pairs of numbers (called coordinates) to mark points on a flat surface (a plane) or in space.

Imagine two perpendicular lines, called axes, intersecting at a point called the **origin**. Each point on the plane has unique coordinates telling how far it is from the origin along each axis.

This system, named after Ren√© Descartes, lets us describe shapes like circles using equations. It's crucial in many fields, like math, physics, and computer graphics.
title: Cartesian coordinate system
